companyProfile.companyDescription: Tata Steel Limited is an India-based global steel company with an annual crude steel capacity of approximately 35 million tons per annum. The Company is primarily engaged in the business of manufacturing and distribution of steel products across the globe. The Company and its subsidiaries have a presence across the value chain of steel manufacturing, from mining and processing iron ore and coal to producing and distributing finished products. Its products include cold rolled (Non-branded), BP sheets, Galvano, HR commercial, hot rolled pickled and oiled and hot rolled skin passed pickled and oiled, high tensile steel strapping, pre-engineered buildings, projects/ tenders, construction and projects, and full hard cold rolled. The Company's brands include MagiZinc, Ymagine, Ympress, Contiflo, Strongbox, SAB Profil, Fischer Profil, Montana, Advantica, Fischertherm, Fischerfireproof, Montanatherm, Montapanel, Swiss Panel, Holorib, Serica, MagiZinc Auto, HyperForm, HILUMIN and Colorcoat.

recentNews.headline: Tata Steel, JSW Steel Q3 hurt by price erosion. Rebound on the horizon?
recentNews.intro: As Tata Steel and JSW Steel navigate a volatile landscape, both companies are positioning themselves for growth. However, profitability concerns linger.
recentNews.imagecaption: Tata Steel Ltd and JSW Steel Ltd saw strong domestic demand in the December quarter. (Image: Pixabay)
recentNews.body: <p>Indian steel majors Tata Steel Ltd and JSW Steel Ltd experienced strong domestic demand in the December quarter (Q3FY25), which helped offset a 12-13% drop in realization for both companies.</p><p>Tata Steels standalone Ebitda declined 8% year-on-year, but was 24% higher than analysts estimates, supported by lower other expenses and 8% growth in volumes. Ebitda is earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization; it is a key measure of profitability for companies. </p><p>Ebitda per tonne was still down 16% to  <span class='webrupee'></span>14,200 due to lower realization and firm raw material prices. The companys European operations, accounting for 38% of consolidated revenue in the first nine months of FY25, recorded lower losses of  <span class='webrupee'></span>740 crore in Q3 vis--vis  <span class='webrupee'></span>2,900 crore last year. Fixed cost for the UK operations declined by about 80 per tonne (about  <span class='webrupee'></span>8,600) after manpower was reduced following the closure of the blast furnace. Losses for Netherlands business also decreased, aided by lower energy costs.</p><p><i>Also Read: </i><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/industry/steel-imports-steelmakers-safeguard-duty-china-imports-amns-tata-steel-jsw-steel-prices-infrastructure-development-11735042186462.html"><i>Bruised by rising imports, steelmakers pin New Year hopes on safeguard duty</i></a></p><p>JSW Steel recorded a similar performance, beating analysts estimates despite a 22% decline in its consolidated Ebitda, supported by 12% growth in volumes. The decline in Ebitda per tonne was sharper at 30% to  <span class='webrupee'></span>8,300. The management has projected coking coal prices to come down by  <span class='webrupee'></span>800-1,200 per tonne in Q4 along with marginally lower iron ore prices, which should help improve its profitability.</p><p>Tata Steel has largely completed its expansion with 5 mtpa (million tonnes per annum) Kalinganagar facility commissioned in September, and limited capex planned for FY26. JSW Steel has several ongoing projects across downstream, captive iron ore mining and slurry pipeline. </p><p>The ramp-up of 5 mtpa expansion at Vijayanagar is in progress, whereas the 1 mpta expansion at its subsidiary, Bhushan Power and Steel Ltd achieved full capacity during the quarter. It had also acquired a 20% stake in a coking coal mine in Q2FY25 which would provide about 1.2 mtpa of coking coal from April. A Kotak Institutional Equities report projects JSW Steels Ebitda per tonne to increase to  <span class='webrupee'></span>13,200 in FY27, along with 9% volume growth over FY24-27.</p><p>While the domestic outlook remains strong, Tata Steel is facing profitability issues for its Netherlands plant, with spreads hitting their lowest point since 2016. The spreads could get worse in Q4 with further decline in realization after annual contract renewals. The unit also faces uncertainty related to its clean energy transition. </p><p><i>Also Read: </i><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/stock-market-news/tata-steel-q2-earnings-stock-price-investors-europe-operations-netherlands-uk-11731051447818.html"><i>Tata Steel investors may remain jittery amid delayed revival in European operations</i></a></p><p>The management has indicated its keenness to undertake a restructuring exercise involving reduction of manpower and fixed costs. Encouragingly, its subsidiary, Neelachal Ispat Nigam Ltd, achieved full capacity utilization and improvement in Ebitda by  <span class='webrupee'></span>3,000 per tonne, with better economies of scale. The unit has achieved Ebitda margin of 20%, up from 13% in Q2.</p><p>From their respective 52-week highs, Tata Steel's share price has declined almost 30% with limited growth visibility, whereas JSW Steel has fared better with a decline of 12% as the outlook remains strong. According to Bloomberg data, the stocks are trading at enterprise values of 6.8x and 8.9x FY26 estimated Ebitda, respectively.</p><p>To be sure, the near-term prospects appear bright on account of falling input costs, lower imports, and expected government capex in Q4FY25. Volume gains from the ramp-up of Kalinganagar for Tata Steel and Vijayanagar for JSW Steel would be key triggers for the stocks. The icing on the cake would be an announcement of safeguard duties, which the industry is eagerly waiting for.</p><p><i>Also Read | </i><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/budget/expectations/steel-industry-union-budget-infrastructure-investment-steel-import-jsw-steel-tata-steel-jindal-steel-nippon-steel-11737627963021.html"><i>Budget 2025: Infra spending, safeguard duty top steel industry's wish list</i></a></p>

recentNews.headline: WATCH | D Gukesh's epic response to Magnus Carlsen calling him very optimistic player, doesnt bluff'
recentNews.intro: D Gukesh, who triumphed over Dutch Grandmaster Max Warmerdam in the 10th round of the Tata Steel Chess Tournament on January 30, has addressed recent comments made by World Number 1 Magnus Carlsen.
recentNews.imagecaption: World Chess Champion D Gukesh (PTI Photo)
recentNews.body: <p>World Chess Champion D Gukesh, who secured a win over Dutch Grandmaster Max Warmerdam in the 10th round of the Tata Steel Chess Tournament on January 30, has responded to recent comments made by World Number 1 Magnus Carlsen. In his remarks, Carlsen described Gukesh as a very optimistic player who doesnt bluff.</p><p>During a post-match interview, Gukesh was asked about Carlsen's comment from last week, where he said, He's a very optimistic player and he also said in his opinion, you (Gukesh) don't bluff so much. He was asked if he agrees with Carlen on his comments.</p><p>Responding to the question, Gukesh said, Optimistic for sure, but I also bluff. It also depends on the position, opponent and stuff. It is not like I never do, but also I am not a huge bluffer I think.</p><p> </p><p>In <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/sports/news/d-gukesh-hopes-for-chess-inclusion-at-olympics-world-champion-says-id-love-to-see-especially-if-its-in-india-11737094568259.html">another video</a> which is being surfaced on the Internet shows Carlens praising Gukesh. While the exact timing of the video remains unclear, Carlsen shared his thoughts on <i>GIBCHESS Youtube </i>and said, I noticed Gukesh around the time he became a grandmaster. He was 12 then, one of the youngest grandmasters of all time. You could sense that he had something. He was playing an extremely ambitious kind of chess, which was not quite the same as others. At that time he did not have the strength to actually sustain that, so he actually lost a lot of games. But I think I drew my game against him, and he was actually better in that game.</p><p> </p><h2>Gukesh Vs Carlsen</h2><p>After his win in Singapore, <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/sports/news/viswanathan-anand-shuts-down-magnus-carlsen-for-criticising-gukesh-s-world-championship-match-11736434294244.html">chess great Magnus Carlsen</a> had said that classical chess was perhaps the "worst way" to measure a player, adding that rapid chess was perhaps a more "pure" form of chess. He said that Gukesh's World Chess Championship final against China's Ding Liren looked like a second or third round match in an open tournament.</p><p>However, Gukesh responded to Carlsen after his win in Singapore, stating that he understood that the quality of the games wasnt always up to the mark, but overall, it was a good championship match. While Gukesh challenged Carlsen to the title, the Norwegian has ruled out such a title clash.</p>

recentNews.headline: Budget 2025: Infra spending, safeguard duty top steel industry's wish list
recentNews.intro: Rising imports of steel have been the biggest worry among domestic steelmakers over the past year. Inbound steel shipments grew 22% in 2024 to 9.2 million tonnes led by a surge in imports from China and Japan.
recentNews.imagecaption: Steelmakers will be looking for budgetary announcements around green steel,
recentNews.body: <p>The Indian steel industry will be looking for two key announcements from finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman in the upcoming Union budget  continued investment in infrastructure and a safeguard duty on the import of the alloy.</p><p>Steelmakers will also be looking for budgetary announcements around green steel, including incentives and enabling measures that nudge the industry towards higher sustainability.</p><p>Large domestic steelmakers including JSW Steel, Tata Steel, Jindal Steel & Power and ArcelorMittal <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/companies/nipponus-steel-executives-are-running-out-of-time-to-save-14-billion-deal-11734603184780.html">Nippon Steel</a> India are aggressively adding fresh capacities in anticipation of a healthy demand growth as the Indian economy marches ahead. The government is aiming for a domestic manufacturing capacity of 300 million tonnes of steel a year, up from 180 million tonnes at the end of FY24.</p><p><i>Alos read | </i><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/industry/india-mitigation-carbon-emissions-industries-steel-cement-refineries-fertilisers-carbon-capture-energy-storage-coal-11732857892320.html"><i>India plans mitigation action playbook for high carbon-emitting industries</i></a></p><p>India consumed about 136 million tonnes of steel in FY24, which was 14% higher than the previous year.</p><h2>Steel imports</h2><p>Rising imports of steel have been the biggest worry among domestic steelmakers over the past year. Inbound steel shipments grew 22% in 2024 to 9.2 million tonnes, led by a surge in imports from China and Japan.</p><p>While the volume of imports is small compared with Indias annual steel demand, inexpensive imports are disrupting the prices of domestic steel mills, which claim that the current price levels cannot sustain continued investment in capacity expansion.</p><p>Steelmakers have been lobbying the government for fresh restrictions on the import of the alloy from markets like China, which have increased shipments to India in the past year amid tepid demand from other key steel consumers.</p><p><i>Also read | </i><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/industry/manufacturing/steel-prices-capex-china-imports-hot-rolled-coil-hrc-prices-inflation-dumping-input-costs-11734339064354.html"><i>Govts steel dilemma: Restrict imports and risk inflation or hurt capex?</i></a></p><p>In December, Indias commerce ministry launched a safeguard investigation into the imports of alloy and non-alloy flat steel products following a formal complaint by Indian Steel Association, a lobby of large domestic steelmakers. The aim of the investigation is to ascertain whether the rising imports of steel are causing serious injury to the domestic industry. Based on the outcome of the investigation, the government can take World Trade Organization-compliant safeguard measures to restrict imports.</p><p><i>Also read | </i><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/industry/reliance-chemplast-sanmar-finolex-tata-steel-jsw-steel-china-bis-act-pvc-sector-hot-rolled-steel-coil-trump-vietnam-11737375577029.html"><i>Steel, PVC, Trump tariffs, and China: How India can tackle the dumping crisis</i></a></p><p>The steel ministry and the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) have also introduced several quality control orders (QCO) that seek to restrict the sale of non-BIS compliant steel in the market. While the QCO will curb imports of substandard steel, Indias steel minister has maintained on record that the purpose of the order was not to restrict imports.</p>

recentNews.headline: Stocks to Watch: Coal India, ITC Hotels, Tata Steel, Adani Wilmar, ACC, and more
recentNews.intro: Heres a quick look at stocks likely to be in focus in today's trade.
recentNews.body: <h2>Heres a quick look at stocks likely to be in focus in today's trade.</h2><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-coal-india-share-price-nse-bse-s0003044"><strong>Coal India</strong></a>: The Board of Coal India Ltd., the nation's largest mining company, declared a second interim dividend of  <span class='webrupee'></span>5.60 per equity share for the financial year 2024-25. This dividend, based on the face value of  <span class='webrupee'></span>10 per share, has a record date of January 31, 2025, for eligibility. The payment is scheduled to be disbursed by February 26, 2025. Coal India reported a net profit of  <span class='webrupee'></span>8,491.2 crore for the quarter. However, this represents a 17.5 percent year-on-year (YoY) decline from  <span class='webrupee'></span>10,291.7 crore during the corresponding period of the previous year.</p><p><strong>ITC Hotels</strong>: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) announced that shares of ITC Hotels Ltd., the demerged hotels division of ITC Ltd., will commence trading on January 29, 2025. Shareholders of ITC Ltd. received one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares held in the parent company. The last discovered price for ITC Hotels shares was  <span class='webrupee'></span>260 on the NSE and  <span class='webrupee'></span>270 on the BSE. A second price discovery session is set for January 29, 2025.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-tata-steel-share-price-nse-bse-s0003026"><strong>Tata Steel</strong></a>: Tata Steel reported a net profit of  <span class='webrupee'></span>295.5 crore for Q3 FY25, down 43.4 percent YoY from  <span class='webrupee'></span>522 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company also recorded an exceptional loss of  <span class='webrupee'></span>126.2 crore, which is significantly lower than the  <span class='webrupee'></span>334.13 crore loss in the same period last year. Revenue from operations stood at  <span class='webrupee'></span>53,648.3 crore, surpassing the poll estimate of  <span class='webrupee'></span>52,550 crore but reflecting a 3 percent YoY decline from  <span class='webrupee'></span>55,312 crore. </p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-adani-wilmar-share-price-nse-bse-s0005229"><strong>Adani Wilmar</strong></a>: FMCG major Adani Wilmar posted a remarkable 104 percent year-on-year (YoY) rise in net profit for the third quarter, reaching  <span class='webrupee'></span>411 crore. Revenue from operations surged 31 percent YoY to  <span class='webrupee'></span>16,859 crore. On a sequential basis, net profit grew 32 percent from  <span class='webrupee'></span>311 crore recorded in the September quarter, while revenues rose 17 percent quarter-on-quarter (QoQ). The company reported a healthy volume growth of 5 percent YoY in Q3FY25, despite significant increases in raw material costs.</p><p><strong>ACC</strong>: Cement manufacturer ACC reported a 103 percent year-on-year (YoY) jump in its consolidated net profit for the December quarter, reaching  <span class='webrupee'></span>1,092 crore compared to  <span class='webrupee'></span>538 crore in the corresponding period last year. Revenue from operations for Q3FY25 stood at  <span class='webrupee'></span>5,207 crore, reflecting a 7 percent increase from  <span class='webrupee'></span>4,855 crore in the same quarter of the previous financial year. The profit is attributed to the companys owners.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-petronet-lng-share-price-nse-bse-s0003152"><strong>Petronet LNG</strong></a>: Petronet LNG Ltd., Indias largest liquefied natural gas company, posted a 25.5 percent YoY increase in net profit at  <span class='webrupee'></span>867 crore for Q3 FY25. In the same quarter last year, the company reported a net profit of  <span class='webrupee'></span>1,190.3 crore. Sequentially, the net profit rose 2.3 percent from  <span class='webrupee'></span>847.6 crore in the preceding quarter. Revenue from operations declined 17.09 percent YoY to  <span class='webrupee'></span>12,227 crore from  <span class='webrupee'></span>14,747 crore and fell 6 percent quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) from  <span class='webrupee'></span>13,021.8 crore.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-indraprastha-gas-share-price-nse-bse-s0003114"><strong>Indraprastha Gas</strong></a>: Indraprastha Gas Ltd. reported a net profit of  <span class='webrupee'></span>285.8 crore for Q3 FY25, representing a 33.7 percent sequential decline from  <span class='webrupee'></span>431 crore in the previous quarter. Revenue from operations stood at  <span class='webrupee'></span>3,759.1 crore, slightly below the poll estimate of  <span class='webrupee'></span>3,760 crore, showing a marginal 1.7 percent growth from  <span class='webrupee'></span>3,697 crore in the preceding quarter. EBITDA was reported at  <span class='webrupee'></span>363.7 crore, higher than the estimated  <span class='webrupee'></span>294 crore but down 32.1 percent QoQ from  <span class='webrupee'></span>536 crore.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-union-bank-of-india-share-price-nse-bse-s0003243"><strong>Union Bank of India</strong></a>: Union Bank of India reported a 28.2 percent YoY increase in net profit to  <span class='webrupee'></span>4,603.6 crore for Q3 FY25, compared to  <span class='webrupee'></span>3,589.9 crore in the same quarter last year. Net interest income (NII) grew marginally by 0.8 percent to  <span class='webrupee'></span>9,240.2 crore, up from  <span class='webrupee'></span>9,168 crore in the previous year.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-kaynes-technology-india-share-price-nse-bse-s0005354"><strong>Kaynes Technology</strong></a>: Kaynes Technology India Ltd. reported a robust 47.2 percent YoY increase in net profit at  <span class='webrupee'></span>66.4 crore for Q3 FY25, compared to  <span class='webrupee'></span>45.1 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations surged 29.8 percent YoY to  <span class='webrupee'></span>661.1 crore from  <span class='webrupee'></span>509.2 crore in the corresponding quarter of the prior year.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-federal-bank-share-price-nse-bse-s0003070"><strong>Federal Bank</strong></a>: Federal Bank reported a net profit of  <span class='webrupee'></span>955.4 crore for Q3 FY25, representing a 5 percent YoY decline from  <span class='webrupee'></span>1,006.7 crore in the same quarter of the previous year. Net interest income (NII) rose 14.5 percent YoY to  <span class='webrupee'></span>2,431.3 crore, surpassing the poll estimate of  <span class='webrupee'></span>2,415 crore and marking an all-time high for the bank.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-bajaj-housing-finance-share-price-nse-bse-s0005924"><strong>Bajaj Housing Finance</strong></a>: Bajaj Housing Finance recorded a 25.4 percent YoY rise in net profit to  <span class='webrupee'></span>548 crore for Q3 FY25, compared to  <span class='webrupee'></span>437 crore in the same quarter last year. Net interest income (NII) also grew by 25.1 percent to  <span class='webrupee'></span>933 crore, up from  <span class='webrupee'></span>745.8 crore in the corresponding quarter of FY24, driven by higher loan disbursements.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-emami-share-price-nse-bse-s0003370"><strong>Emami</strong></a>: Emami Ltd. posted a 7 percent YoY increase in net profit to  <span class='webrupee'></span>279 crore for Q3 FY25, compared to  <span class='webrupee'></span>260.7 crore in the same period last year. Revenue rose by 5.3 percent YoY to  <span class='webrupee'></span>1,049.5 crore from  <span class='webrupee'></span>996.3 crore, while EBITDA grew by 7.6 percent to  <span class='webrupee'></span>338.7 crore, up from  <span class='webrupee'></span>314.8 crore in Q3 FY24.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-railtel-corporation-of-india-share-price-nse-bse-s0005051"><strong>RailTel</strong></a>: RailTel Corporation of India Ltd. reported a 4.7 percent YoY increase in net profit to  <span class='webrupee'></span>65 crore for Q3 FY25, compared to  <span class='webrupee'></span>62.1 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations surged 14.8 percent YoY to  <span class='webrupee'></span>767.6 crore, while EBITDA declined 6.6 percent YoY to  <span class='webrupee'></span>121 crore, resulting in a contraction of EBITDA margin to 15.8 percent from 19.4 percent in the prior year.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-tata-power-share-price-nse-bse-s0003067"><strong>Tata Power</strong></a>: Tata Power Renewable Energy Ltd. (TPREL), a subsidiary of Tata Power Company Ltd., secured a  <span class='webrupee'></span>455 crore contract from Maharashtra State Power Generation Company Ltd. (MSPGCL) to supply 300 MWp of ALMM-certified solar modules for the Mukhyamantri Saur Krushi Vahini Yojana (MSKVY) 2.0 project. The modules will be delivered across Maharashtra within the year, affirming TP Solar's position as a leading provider of solar solutions.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/market-stats/stocks-arvind-smartspaces-share-price-nse-bse-s0003239"><strong>Arvind SmartSpaces</strong></a>: Arvind SmartSpaces Ltd. announced the signing of an agreement for a 440-acre industrial park in Ahmedabad with a topline potential of  <span class='webrupee'></span>1,350 crore. Located strategically on NH-47, the project will be developed under a joint development model, with Arvind SmartSpaces holding a 70.5 percent revenue share. This industrial park is positioned to cater to the growing demand for industrial infrastructure and is well-connected to key regions and ports, including Kandla, Mundra, and Pipavav.</p><p> </p>

recentNews.headline: Tata Steel Q3 results: Net profit tanks 43% to  295 crore, revenue drops 2.7% YoY
recentNews.intro: The company reported a consolidated top line of  53,648 crore for the quarter, which was 3% less than what it made during the same period last year. This was despite the company selling 8% more steel year-over-year during the quarter at 7.72 million tonnes.
recentNews.imagecaption: Tata Steel Q3 results: The steelmaker announced its third-quarter results on Monday, January 27.
recentNews.body: <p><strong>Tata Steel Q3 results:</strong> Asias oldest steelmaker Tata Steel blamed Asias largest steelmaker China for a dip in its revenues during the third fiscal quarter ended 31 December.</p><p>The company reported a consolidated top line of  <span class='webrupee'></span>53,648 crore for the <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/topic/q3-results">quarter</a>, which was 3% less than what it made during the same period last year. This was despite the company selling 8% more steel year-over-year during the quarter at 7.72 million tonnes.</p><p>The consolidated profit nearly halved to  <span class='webrupee'></span>295 crore.</p><p>The global operating landscape continues to be shaped by geopolitics and continued economic slowdown in key regions, said T.V. Narendran, the managing director of <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/market/stock-market-news/tata-steel-q3-results-2025-live-updates-tata-steel-q3-earnings-tata-steel-q3-loss-tata-steel-share-price-tata-shares-11737957719864.html">Tata Steel</a>.</p><p>Steel exports from <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/topic/china">China</a>, which has averaged 9 million tonnes per month in 2024, has dampened steel prices globally including in India, he said. Indias steel imports grew 22% in 2024 to 9.2 million tonnes, led by a surge in shipments from China and Japan, as per data from BigMint, a market intelligence firm.</p><p>However, the company managed to beat the street estimates. Analysts polled by <i>Bloomberg </i>had a consensus revenue estimate of  <span class='webrupee'></span>52,438 crore excluding other operating incomes of  <span class='webrupee'></span>417 crore which are also included in the top line by the company.</p><p>Tata Steels European bets continue to be a drag on its financials, but losses have narrowed. It made an Ebitda loss of 67 million (~ <span class='webrupee'></span>724 crore) in the UK during the quarter while its Dutch operations just managed to break even. Ebitda stands for earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization, which is a popular performance metric.</p><p><a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/companies/news/global-steel-sector-struggling-to-generate-profits-demand-increasing-in-india-tata-steel-ceo-11735733912861.html">Tata Steel</a> made  <span class='webrupee'></span>14,964 of Ebitda for every tonne of steel it sold in India. At a consolidated level, which includes the performance of the European unit, Ebitda per tonne dropped to  <span class='webrupee'></span>7,759.</p><p>Both in UK and Netherlands, our performance has been adversely impacted by multi-year low market spreads, last seen in 2015-16, said Koushik Chatterjee, chief financial officer, Tata Steel.</p><p>The closure of some end-of-life assets in the UK and the consequent fall in fixed costs helped the company narrow its losses in the UK by 115 per tonne compared to the preceding quarter, he said. The company has shut its blast furnaces and related equipment in the UK and has placed orders for an electric arc furnace to replace the coal-fired <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/topic/manufacturing">manufacturing </a>assets. The transition to the new process is expected to make the UK operations environmentally and financially sustainable.</p><p>But the share of bad news from Europe is not over for the company. Last month, it received two penalty orders from the Environment Agency (EA) of the Netherlands which fined it  <span class='webrupee'></span>239 crore for non-compliance with emission thresholds. In a separate notice, the environmental watchdog threatened to shut one of Tata Steels two coke and gas plants in the country if it didnt comply with certain conditions within 12 months.</p><p>The orders and notices were unlikely to lead to a shutdown of Tata Steels coke and gas plants, the company said Tuesday. The company plans to file objections against the orders and the notice with the appropriate authority in due course, it said without elaborating further.</p><p>Tata Steel shares closed 2.77% lower on the BSE on Tuesday at  <span class='webrupee'></span>126.40. The earnings were disclosed after market hours. The benchmark Sensex ended the session 1.08% lower.</p>

recentNews.headline: Uzbek grandmaster Nodirbek Yakubboev declines handshake with India's Vaishali, apologises later: I do not touch...
recentNews.intro: In a recent chess tournament, Uzbek Grandmaster Nodirbek Yakubboev's refusal to shake hands with India's Vaishali due to religious beliefs ignited a social media uproar. While he later apologized, the incident raises questions about cultural norms and respect in the world of competitive sports.
recentNews.imagecaption: Nodirbek Yakubboev refuses to shake hands with R Vaishali.
recentNews.body: <p>Grandmaster Nodirbek Yakubboev stirred up controversy at the Tata Steel Chess Tournament after he refused to shake hands with India's Grandmaster R Vaishali.</p><p>In a clip of the incident that went viral on social media, Vaishali can be seen extending her hand before the start of a fourth-round contest against Yakubboev, who sat down without responding, leaving the Indian visibly awkward.</p><p>Yakubboev, 23, who became a Grandmaster in 2019, lost the match and is currently on three points after eight rounds in the Challengers' section.</p><p>The viral video left Yakubboev the centre of attacks from <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/news/trends/mumbai-man-forgets-coldplay-ticket-for-ahmedabad-concert-in-hurry-netizens-say-lost-all-fun-11737910735088.html">netizens</a> who claimed that the Uzbek player was racist.</p><p>However, in a lengthy X post, Nodirbek Yakubboev apologised, saying that he meant no disrespect and didn't respond to Vaishali's gesture because of religious reasons.</p><p>Vaishali did not offer her hand after beating the Uzbek player. The Indian is on four points after eight rounds with five more to go.</p><h2>Watch the viral video here:</h2><p>Netizens have also claimed that Yakubboev had shook hands with his female opponent in 2023 and was just discriminating against the Indian grandmaster. </p><h2>Here's what Nodirbek Yakubboev said:</h2><p>After the video went viral, Yakubboev said he had all the respect for Vaishali and her younger brother R Praggnanandhaa but he does not touch other women due to religious reasons.</p><p>I want to explain the situation that happened in the game with Vaishali. With all due respect to women and <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/news/trends/indian-chess-players-recreate-rohit-sharmas-victory-dance-to-celebrate-historic-double-gold-at-olympiad-2024-watch-11727073456579.html">Indian chess players</a>, I want to inform everyone that I do not touch other women for religious reasons, wrote Yakubboev, who is a practising <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/news/trends/muslim-woman-in-burqa-mocked-at-restaurant-by-foreign-tourist-heres-what-police-say-11736062994840.html">Muslim</a>.</p><p>I respect Vaishali and her brother as the strongest chess players in India. If I have offended her with my behaviour, I apologise. I have some additional explanations: 1. <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/sports/news/arjun-erigaisis-slump-from-top-continues-as-the-world-no-5-loses-lower-ranked-dutch-max-warmerdam-at-tata-chess-masters-11737870606304.html">Chess</a> is not haram, Yakubboev wrote.</p><p>I do what I need to do. I do not insist others not to shake hands with the opposite gender or for women to wear hijab or burqa. It is their business what to do, he explained.</p><p>Yakubboev said that in order to avoid such a situation in the eighth-round game against Romania's Irina Bulmaga, he informed her in advance about his religious beliefs.</p><p>Today (Sunday), I told Irina Bulmaga about it. She agreed to it, he added.</p><p>The Uzbek GM shared that after he came to the playing hall, the arbiters told him that he should at least do Namaste as a gesture. In the games with Divya and Vaishali I couldn't tell them about it before the game and there was an awkward situation, he said.</p><p>Another Uzbek player Nodirbek Abdusattorov is playing in the 'Open' section of the tournament.</p><p>(<i>With PTI inputs</i>)</p>

recentNews.headline: Tata Steel Q3 Results 2025 Highlights: Net profit falls 43% to  295 crore, revenue down 3% YoY
recentNews.intro: Tata Steel Q3 Results 2025 Highlights: Tata Steel reported a 43.4 per cent decline in consolidated net profit to  295.49 crore for the quarter ended on December 31, 2024, due to lower income.
recentNews.imagecaption: Tata Steel Q3 Results 2025 Highlights: Tata Steel is scheduled to report its Q3 results today.
recentNews.body:
<p><strong>Tata Steel Q3 Results 2025 Highlights:</strong> Tata Group-owned Indian steel manufacturing giant Tata Steel announced its October to December quarter results on Monday, January 27, reporting a drop of 43 per cent to <span class='webrupee'></span>295.49 crore, compared with <span class='webrupee'></span>522.14 crore in the same period a year ago. The revenue from operations dropped 2.7 per cent due to the fall in revenues in the core business segment to <span class='webrupee'></span>53,231 crore in the quarter ended December 31, 2024, compared to <span class='webrupee'></span>54,727.30 crore in the same quarter the previous financial year.</p><p>Analysts expect Tata Steels revenue in Q3FY25 to fall two per cent sequentially and around five per cent year-on-year (YoY). Steel mills across Asia have been grappling with lower prices due to a glut of imports from China, prompting anti-dumping measures and investigations. Even as Indias steel demand is expected to rise, weak domestic prices and a slowing economy have compelled steelmakers to keep prices low.</p><p><i><strong>Stay tuned to Tata Steel Q3 Results 2025 Live Blog for the latest updates.</strong></i></p><p>08:31 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Tata Steel share price trend

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Tata Steel Ltd shares closed 2.77 per cent lower at <span class='webrupee'></span>126.40, compared to <span class='webrupee'></span>130 at the previous stock market session on Friday. The company released the third-quarter results after market operating hours on January 27.</p><p>Shares hit their 52-week high level at <span class='webrupee'></span>184.60 on June 18, 2024, while the 52-week low level was at <span class='webrupee'></span>122.60 on January 13, 2025, according to data collected from BSE. The market capitalisation for the steelmaker stands at Rs1,57,790.72 crore as of January 27, 2025.</p><p>07:56 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Employee benefits

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: The Employee Benefits segment witnessed an almost seven per cent drop to <span class='webrupee'></span>6,072 crore, compared with <span class='webrupee'></span>6,527 crore in the previous financial year. Meanwhile, the company's Other Expenses dropped 11.6 per cent to <span class='webrupee'></span>17,742 crore, compared to <span class='webrupee'></span>20,074.73 crore in the same period a year ago.</p><p>07:46 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: India deliveries

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: The steel major had earlier said that its India crude steel production grew by six per cent to 5.68 million tonnes (MT) in the third quarter of the current fiscal compared to 5.35 MT in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal. Deliveries in India reached 5.29 MT for the third quarter, up 8.4 per cent Y-o-Y, due to steady sales in the domestic market and strategic presence in exports.</p><p>07:34 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Global earnings

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Tata Steel Netherlands reported liquid steel production of 1.76 million tonnes for the third quarter with deliveries at 1.53 million tonnes. Tata Steel UKs output stood at zero for the quarter on account of closure of its blast furnaces in Q2FY2025. Deliveries dropped 12.5 per cent YoY to 0.56 million tonnes.</p><p>07:25 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Total expenses of Tata Steel dropped to 52,118.09 crore

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: The consolidated income declined to <span class='webrupee'></span>53,869.33 crore in the October-December period from <span class='webrupee'></span>55,539.77 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal, according to an exchange filing by Tata Steel. Total expenses of Tata Steel dropped to <span class='webrupee'></span>52,118.09 crore over 53,351.13 in the year-ago period.</p><p>07:00 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Revenue from operations also dropped 3%

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: The metal giant's revenue from operations in Q3FY25 totaled <span class='webrupee'></span>53,648 crore, marking a 3 per cent decline compared to <span class='webrupee'></span>55,312 crore in the same quarter of the previous fiscal year.</p><p>06:46 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Net profit falls 36% YoY to 327 crore

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Tata Steel, on Monday, posted a 36 per cent year-on-year (YoY) decline in its net profit to <span class='webrupee'></span>32 crore for the quarter ending on December 31, 2024.</p><p>05:04 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Steel prices struggle across geographies

<p>According to Elara Capital, Chinas hot-rolled coil (HRC) export prices remained stable in December after experiencing a ~6% decline in November. The Chinese steel market is grappling with challenges stemming from decreasing finished steel demand and an uncertain future, particularly as the Lunar New Year holidays approach. This situation has affected global steel prices, with North Europe, Japan, and the US seeing drops of about ~1% MoM, ~2% MoM, and ~5% MoM, respectively.</p><p>In India, both primary long product prices and HRC prices fell by approximately ~3% MoM. The decrease in long product prices was attributed to weak demand and liquidity issues, while flat steel prices faced downward pressure from cheap imports and cautious buying behavior. So far in January, HRC and primary long product prices have both dipped about ~1% compared to December averages. Interestingly, iron ore prices in China and Australia actually rose, with increases of ~1% and ~2% MoM, respectively, in December.</p><p>04:42 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: All you need to know about dividend 

<p>As per data from trendlyne.com, Tata Steel has announced 30 dividends since May 24, 2001. Over the last year, Tata Steel Ltd. has declared an equity dividend totaling <span class='webrupee'></span>3.60 per share. With the current share price at <span class='webrupee'></span>126.5500, Tata Steel Ltd.'s dividend yield stands at 2.84%.</p><p>04:25 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Here's what ICICI Securities says about the Q3 earnings of the Tata Group co

<p>Loss at Tata Steel Europe could narrow to USD 55 (Q2FY25: USD 77 loss) mainly as loss at TS-UK is likely to halve. However, non-cash impact of forex translation needs to be seen. </p><p>04:11 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: China steel price trend upward post stimulus announcement

<p>China domestic HRC prices witnessed growth by ~4% QoQ in 3Q to USD485/t in anticipation of increased steel demand post the China stimulus announcement. Chinese rebar prices too witnessed growth by ~3% QoQ in 3Q to USD508/t after witnessing a fall in 2Q due to subdued China demand. Chinas steel exports moderated to 9.3mn tonnes in Nov24 (down ~17%MoM), according to reports. </p><p>03:55 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Indian steel players likely to witness mixed trend in margins

<p>Indian steel markets witnessed a divergent price trend with long products prices moving up by ~INR1k/t while flat product prices declined by ~INR2.5k/t. NMDC announced price hike twice in fines by INR400/t each in 3Q. Steel companies guided for a ~USD20-25/t decline in coking coal consumption cost for 3QFY25, according to JM Financial brokerage. </p><p>03:41 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Stock Check 

<p>Tata Steel share price today ended 2.77% lower at <span class='webrupee'></span>126.40 apiece on BSE.</p><p>03:24 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live:  Global steel making witness mix trends in 3Q:

<p>Coking coal prices witnessed marginal decline to USD203/t (down by USD8/t QoQ) given stable weather conditions in Australia and reduced risk of supply disruptions with spot prices at USD197/t. China iron ore CFR price witnessed marginal growth by ~2% QoQ to USD95/t. In tandem with rising global iron ore prices, NMDC also increased its prices twice by <span class='webrupee'></span>400/t each in Oct24, according to JM Financial report. </p><p>03:06 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Q3 Results Preview

<p>According to Nuvama, Standalone EBITDA/t is expected to decline by <span class='webrupee'></span>1,760 QoQ to <span class='webrupee'></span>11,375 owing to decrease in blended realisation (down <span class='webrupee'></span>2,500/t QoQ; higher than normal due to lower auto contract price for H2FY25), partially offset by lower coking coal price (down USD20/t QoQ). Tata Steel Europes losses are expected to decrease (EBITDA of -USD58/t compared with -USD75/t in Q2FY25) owing to lower RM cost and fixed cost at UK, partially offset by decrease in steel prices in Netherlands. The Netherlands operations are expected to report an EBITDA loss while UK losses are likely to decrease QoQ.</p><p>02:44 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Nuvama expects Q3 to be a mixed bag for Steel cos

<p>We expect Q3FY25E Ferrous profitability to be a mixed bag with EBITDA/t ranging from +INR1,100/t to -INR1,800/t QoQ. We observe an average QoQ increase of INR600700/t in longs prices and a drop in flats of INR2,4002,500/t QoQ. During Q3FY25, while coking coal cost dipped USD2025/t QoQ, iron ore cost rose INR300400/t QoQ," the brokerage said.</p><p>02:29 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Steel Sector Outlook

<p>According to Axis Securities, Chinas steel demand uncertainty continues to linger despite stimulus measures announced in Sep24. Its property sector showed some signs of improvement with transactions rising in major cities. However, the 3-MMA YoY YTD floor space started continues to remain in negative territory and has declined by 19% in Sept24. Chinas Jan-Nov24 crude steel production stood at 929 MT down 2.7% YoY. Despite the drop in production, exports remained high over the same period at 101 MT, up 21% YoY, indicating domestic demand weakness.</p><p>02:08 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Q3 FY25 Earnings Preview

<p> We expect consolidated revenues to fall by 3% QoQ and c.5.5% YoY at <span class='webrupee'></span>522.6b led by falling realizations. We expect TATA to report an EBITDA of c.Rs54.8b with EBITDA margins of 10.5% on a consolidated basis led by reducing realizations being partially offset with higher volumes and savings on coking coal costs vs Q2FY25,"  said YES Securities.</p><p>01:21 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Stock Check 

<p>At 13:19 IST, Tata Steel share price was trading 1.15% lower at <span class='webrupee'></span>128.55 apiece on BSE. </p><p>01:06 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Indian steel producers have been facing considerable challenges

<p>Indian steel producers have been facing significant challenges since the beginning of FY25, primarily due to a consistent decline in global steel prices. According to a report by Yes Securities, the average price of steel in China fell from approximately $524 per ton in Q1 FY25 to around $470 per ton in Q2 FY25. During Q3 FY25, prices have remained range-bound between $480 and $500 per ton.</p><p>This pressure on steel prices has adversely affected the earnings of producers in the sector. However, there is a silver lining; the volatility in coking coal prices appears to have stabilized. This stabilization is expected to provide some relief to steel manufacturers and may positively impact their performance in Q3 FY25.</p><p>12:44 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Here's what Osho Krishan of Angel One says about the Tata Group stock 

<p>Tata Steel is presently at a pivotal stage, positioned right at the breakout neckline on a broader time frame. While the stock is technically in a corrective phase, it is encountering difficulties in surpassing its short-term moving averages. This struggle indicates a lack of upward momentum. Until it breaks through these moving averages, the general outlook for the stock remains bearish, leaning towards a sideways trend in the market. </p><p>On the levels front, 122-118 is likely to act as near-term support, while a sturdy hurdle is placed around the 136-140 zone, and a deceive breakthrough could only portray a counter-trend in the stock price.</p><p>12:27 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Check out Axis Securities views on Q3 earnings 

<p>Provisional sales volume at India stood at 5.29 MT (up 8.4%/3.5%YoY/QoQ) and at Europe at 2.09 MT (up 7.7%, down 1.9% QoQ). The brokerage expect consolidated revenue to decline YoY/QoQ led by lower steel price realization in India and Europe, partially offset by our higher steel sales volumes estimate. </p><p>We expect EBITDA to decline by ~23% YoY/QoQ each due to lower sales realisation in India and Europe, which offsets benefit from lower coking coal costs and higher sales volumes," the brokerage said.</p><p>12:13 PM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Stock Check 

<p>Tata Steel share price was down nearly 2% ahead of its Q3 results. Riyank Arora, Technical Analyst, Mehta Equities Ltd stated that Tata Steel stock has touched its major anchor vwap support mark of 128 and seen to be rebounding from those levels. A strict stoploss can be kept here at 125 and longs can be initiated for upside move towards 132-133 as some bit of recovery is expected in the metal sector from lower levels.</p><p>11:59 AM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Here's all you need to know about Q2 earnings of the Tata Group company 

<p>Tata Steel Ltd showed a significant turnaround in its financials for the quarter ending September 2024, reporting a net profit of <span class='webrupee'></span>833 crore. This stands in stark contrast to the loss of <span class='webrupee'></span>6,196 crore reported during the same quarter last year. However, the company did experience a 3% decline in revenue from operations, which totaled <span class='webrupee'></span>53,905 crore this quarter.</p><p>The Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization (EBITDA) for the period was recorded at <span class='webrupee'></span>6,141 crore, giving the company an EBITDA margin of 11.4%.</p><p>11:36 AM IST</p>

Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Tata Group company to announce Q3 results today

<p>Tata Steel Q3 Results Live: Tata Steel is scheduled to report its Q3 results today. Tata Steel board will meet and approve financial results for the third quarter of FY25 today, January 27. </p><p><i>Disclaimer: The views and recommendations above are those of individual analysts, experts and broking companies, not of Mint. We advise investors to check with certified experts before making any investment decision.</i></p>

recentNews.headline: Arjun Erigaisi's slump from top continues as the world no.5 loses lower ranked Dutch Max Warmerdam at Tata Chess Masters
recentNews.intro: Arjun Erigaisi is yet to win a single game at the Tata Steel Masters. The Indian lost four and drew three games and will face world champion D Gukesh and Uzbek star Nodirbek Abdusattarov next.
recentNews.imagecaption: Arjun Erigaisi is currently competing at the Tata Steel Masters.
recentNews.body: <p>Days after being dethroned by compatriot D Gukesh in the FIDE rankings, Arjun Erigaisi saw yet another slump in his career when the Indian lost to Dutch world.82 Max Warmerdam at the ongoing Tata Chess Masters. Arjun Erigaisi who held the no.4 spot in the FIDE rankings, had lost his place to world champion D Gukesh.</p><p>Nicknames as 'Wimbledon of Chess', <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/sports/news/indias-arjun-erigaisi-defeats-magnus-carlsen-fabiano-caruana-to-win-online-chess-event-11736946202400.html">Arjun Erigaisi</a> is going through the toughest phase of his career as he is yet to get a single win in seven games at the Tata Steel Masters in the Dutch town of Wijk aan Zee.</p><p>So far, Arjun Erigaisi has lost four games and drew three. He is yet to face in-form players - <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/sports/news/d-gukesh-r-praggnanandhaa-pause-games-at-tata-chess-masters-watch-in-awe-as-messi-of-chess-shocks-indian-im-11737867955408.html">D Gukesh</a> and Uzbek star Nodirbek Abdusattarov at the competition. Notably, the win over over Arjun Erigaisi was Warmerdam's first win over of the event.</p><p>The Dutch star is almost 150 points below <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/news/trends/anand-mahindra-to-the-rescue-chess-grandmaster-arjun-erigaisi-wins-us-visa-hurdle-11735092235338.html">Arjun Erigaisi</a>, rated at 2646. With this loss, Arjun Erigaisi has now dropped 29 rating points in the past 10 days. Last year, Arjun Erigaisi had won 63 points to break into the top five of the world rankings.</p><h2>What happened in Arjun Erigaisi vs Max Warmerdam tie?</h2><p>The Indian was on the backfoot from as early as 12th move as he played an inaccuracy and doubled it with another similar move in the next. When the engine showed 12 Qd7 was the best move, Arjun Erigaisi played 12 e6?!.</p><p>On move 13, he made another ill-advised pawn push - on the b file, Arjun Erigaisi played 13 b5?! when the engine said that 13 Nd7 was the best option. The Indian started to trail from move 25 and eventually conceded the match on move 38.</p><p>Meanwhile, world no.1 Magnus Carlsen felt that Arjun Erigaisi's poor form is a bit of mental thing and need not to be worried about. Im not sure we should read all that much into it (Erigaisis results), Carlsen told on Chess.com. </p><p>Weve seen Caruana before the Candidates having a nightmare of a tournament and then winning the event. So Im not sure if we need to read all that much into it. I guess it becomes a little bit of a mental (issue) at some point if youre struggling at the very same tournament that you were struggling at before, he added. </p>

recentNews.headline: OP Jindals empire of steel is powered by grit and determination
recentNews.intro: In the 1950s, when most of his contemporaries were seeking steady government employment, he took the unconventional path by learning about pipe bending and welding as a trader of steel pipes and tubes.
recentNews.imagecaption: Jindal was born into a modest family in 1930 in a hamlet in Nalwa, Haryana. Illustration: Tarun Kumar Sahu/Mint
recentNews.body: <p>In the pantheon of India's industrial titans, few stories capture the imagination as that of Om Prakash Jindal. From a humble bucket-manufacturing workshop in Hisar to building one of India's largest steel empires, his story reads like a masterclass in entrepreneurial audacity. What truly set him apart was the rare ability to seamlessly navigate both the unforgiving world of heavy industry and the intricate maze of politics.</p><h2>The industrialists apprenticeship</h2><p>Long before he became known as the patriarch of the Jindal group, he was a young man with an obsession for understanding how things worked. In the 1950s, when most of his contemporaries were seeking steady government employment, he took the unconventional path by learning about pipe bending and welding as a trader of steel pipes and tubes. This hands-on experience meant that he was never just another businessman giving orders from his air-conditioned office  he understood the nuts and bolts of his business.</p><p>Born into a modest family in 1930 in a hamlet in Nalwa, Haryana, Jindals journey was anything but conventional. Packed off to Kolkata (then Calcutta) as a young boy, he learnt the basics of wholesale and retail textile trading. Soon, though, he realised that steel was the backbone of a nation, and with that began his vision for a business that would, by the time of his tragic death in a helicopter clash in 2005, have an annual turnover exceeding $4 billion and operations spanning several continents.</p><p>Also read: <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/newsletters/business-family-feuds-babasaheb-kalyani-sugandha-hiremath-kirloskar-family-murugappa-group-lodha-group-11737462801576.html">A 53-year-old Harvard article holds clues to Indias business family feuds</a></p><p>Kolkata was his <i>karam bhoomi</i>. It is here that he started out as a metals trader, though he went on to set up his first plant in Liluah, a neighborhood in Howrah. Barely in his 20s, he followed this up with another plant in the city as part of his newly established company Jindal India Ltd. He subsequently established Jindal Steel and Power, JSW Group and Jindal Stainless Limited.</p><p>The genesis of the groups subsequent expansion and success was his masterful grasp of vertical integration and his stress on innovation. By controlling the sources of raw materials such as iron ore and coal through mining ventures, he ensured a stable supply chain for his steel production. Establishing power plants ensured his steel business always had a steady source of electricity. This holistic approach insulated his industries against external shocks and allowed for better control of the value chain.</p><p>In the late 1960s, when Indias steel sector was dominated by giants such as Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL) and Tata Iron and Steel Company (TISCO), he had the prescience to move into steel pipes. In 1983 he set up India's first private sector cold rolling mill in Thane. It was a smart move, given Indias heavy import dependence on special steel products.</p><p>This ability to think out of the box also gave him access to badly needed capital. During the pre-liberalisation era, when domestic funding was scarce, he leveraged export earnings to fund expansion, built strong banking relationships, used supplier credits innovatively, and created joint ventures for technology and markets.</p><p>Without the privileges of a formal education, he relied on an intuitive understanding of business and an uncanny ability to spot opportunities. The boy who wanted to become a wrestler eventually became an industry titan. His journey from combative to complementary saw him learn and teach the value of collaboration  a hallmark of all successful endeavours.</p><h2>Politician with a spine of steel</h2><p>What truly set him apart, however, was his unique position in politics. Unlike many businessmen and politicians who used their positions to advance their own business interests, he approached politics with the same straightforward approach that characterised his business dealings. As an MLA and later power minister in Haryana, he was known to speak his mind even when it did not align with his partys position. His political style, bereft of grandiose promises or rhetorical speeches, was a refreshing departure from the usual politicians spiel. </p><p>Also read: <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/industry/jamnalal-bajaj-philanthropy-bajaj-group-bajaj-auto-business-political-history-congress-mahatma-gandhi-rahul-bajaj-11737011892285.html">Jamnalal Bajaj and the alchemy of business philanthropy</a></p><p>Instead, he brought to politics his businessmans pragmatism. Not surprisingly, his constituency Hisar benefited from improved infrastructure and industrial growth during his tenure. After his death in 2005, his second wife Savitri took over his political mantle, a tradition that has continued with his son Naveen Jindal.</p><h2>A rare successful succession</h2><p>Before he passed away, he put in place a succession plan which ensured that, when the group carried out a formal family division in 2009, the process was smooth and without acrimony. On his death, Prithviraj inherited the steel pipes business, Sajjan the carbon steel business, and Naveen the power business, while the stainless steel business went to Ratan Jindal. The family subsequently sorted out the complex cross-holding structure, simplifying it such that the four sons and their mother Savitri Devi received 20% of the promoters stake in the five holding companies that were created.</p><p>Om Prakash Jindals rise from modest beginnings in a small Indian town to forging a vast industrial empire is a reminder that even in the face of immense challenges, the spirit of innovation and the courage to dream big can lead to extraordinary achievements.</p><p>Also read: <a class="manualbacklink" target="_blank" href="https://www.livemint.com/opinion/online-views/gopal-vittal-neville-noronha-dmart-airtel-reliance-jio-hul-avenue-supermarts-wipro-infosys-e-commerce-sunil-mittal-11736943390282.html">Gopal Vittal and Neville Noronha leave behind key lessons in partnership</a></p>
